intro: Tafalla colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian tafalla, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
